page.title: 16Traffic
page.content: Passing through the main study area is the main rod from Kirkwall to Stromnesss, the A965. It is a single carriage road with a tarmac surface and has recently been widened to 7.5 metres. The heaviest traffic is on this road in the morning just before 9 o' clock when people who live in Stromness are travelling to work in Kirkwall.In the late afternoon about five o'clock the traffic builds up as the workers return. There is also a burst of heavy traffic, especially heavy commercial vehicles after 2 o'clock when the St. Ola, the Pentland Firth ferry, docks.On Friday June 14th. just before lunch, vehicles were passing through Stenness at this rate per hour:_ Cars 70, Vans l7, Lorries 9,Tractors 2. 4 cyclists and 7 pedestrians also passed by in this period.
